ygData.subject: Re: Out of Memory Error
ygData.msgSnippet: Gordon Thanks for the suggestion. It is in line with what I have done. I have reduced the heap size to 1G and resumed the crawl.

--- In archive-crawl=
er@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> My suggestion remai=
ns to run with a smaller heap.
> 
> You had mentioned you were running with=
 a 3GB heap. This part of the 
> progress-statistics shows you're nowhere n=
ear using that up:
> 
> mem-use-KB heap-size-KB
> 1623524 1642048
> 
> Toge=
ther with the OutOfMemoryError without a "Java heap size" message, 
> this =
indicates the problem is not in Java object-space, but some native 
> resou=
rce or memory pool. Such problems can be made worse by a large 
> heap, bec=
ause that leaves less memory for other JVM activity.
> 
> I don't recall se=
eing how many threads you're running with, but each 
> thread does require =
more non-heap memory -- especially if you've 
> increased the per-thread st=
ack size (-Xss) for any reason. So if you're 
> using a lot of threads, red=
ucing the number (or the -Xss value) might 
> also help. (From the single p=
rogress-statistics.log line you've 
> forwarded, the crawler does not look =
busy.)
> 
> Hope this helps,
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> anitabidari wrote:
> >=

> >

gress stats

ecause the
